chapter.pericope: A Lament over the Nation and Land of Egypt
chapter.p: 1And the word of Yahweh cameLiterally “was” to me, saying,Literally “to say” 2“Son of man,Or “mortal,” or “son of humankind” prophesy, and you must say, ‘thus says the Lord Yahweh:

ul.li1: “Wail, alas! For the day!
ul.li2: 3For a day is near;
indeed, a day is near for Yahweh.
ul.li1: A day of cloud,
ul.li2: a time of the nations it will be.
ul.li1: 4And a sword will come in Egypt,
ul.li2: and anguish will be in Cush,
ul.li1: at the falling of the slain in Egypt.
And they will take its wealth,
ul.li2: and its foundation will be demolished.

chapter.p: 5Cush and Put and Lud and all of Arabia and Kub and the peopleOr “children” of the land of the treatyOr “covenant” with them—by the sword they will fall.”

ul.li1: “And the supporters of Egypt will fall,
ul.li2: and the majesty of its strength will go down
ul.li1: from Migdol to Syene;
ul.li2: by the sword they will fall in it,”
ul.li1: declaresLiterally “declaration of” the Lord Yahweh.
7“And they will be desolate in the midst of desolate countries,
ul.li2: and its cities will be in the midst of ruined cities.
ul.li1: 8And they will know that I am Yahweh
ul.li2: when I put my fire in Egypt,
and all of its helpers are broken.

chapter.p: 9On that day messengers will go down from before meLiterally “to the face of me” in the ships to terrify unsuspecting Cush, and anguish will be in them on the day of Egypt; for look, it is coming!”

ul.li1: “And I will put an end to the crowdsOr “hordes” of Egypt
ul.li2: by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon.
ul.li1: 11He and his people with him, the most ruthless of nations,
ul.li2: will be brought to destroy the land.
ul.li1: And they will draw their swords against Egypt,
ul.li2: and they will fill the land with the slain,
ul.li1: 12and I will make the Nile streams dry land,
ul.li2: and I will sell the land into the hand of bad people,
ul.li1: and I will lay waste the land and its fullness
ul.li2: by the hand of strangers.

ul.li1: “And I will destroy the idols,
ul.li2: and I will put an end to the worthless idols from Memphis.
ul.li1: And there will no longer beLiterally “not be any longer” a prince from the land of Egypt,
ul.li2: and I will put fear in the land of Egypt.
ul.li1: 14And I will lay waste Pathros,
ul.li2: and I will set fire in Zoan,
and I will execute judgments in No.That is, Thebes
ul.li1: 15I will pour out my rage over Sin,
ul.li2: the stronghold of Egypt,
and I will cut off the crowdOr “horde” of No.That is, Thebes
ul.li1: 16And I will set fire in Egypt,
ul.li2: certainly Sin will writhe,
ul.li1: and NoThat is, Thebes will be breached,
ul.li2: and Memphis will face enemies daily.Literally “of by day”
ul.li1: 17The young men of On and Pi Beseth will fall by the sword,
ul.li2: and they will go into captivity.
ul.li1: 18And at Tahpanhes the day will become dark
ul.li2: when I break the yoke of Egypt,
ul.li1: and in it the majesty of its strength
ul.li2: will come to an end.
ul.li1: A cloud will cover it,
ul.li2: and its daughters will go into captivity.
ul.li1: 19And I will execute judgments in Egypt,
ul.li2: and they will know that I am Yahweh.”

chapter.p: 20And thenLiterally “and it was” in the eleventhLiterally “on one ten” year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, the word of Yahweh cameLiterally “was” to me, saying,Literally “to say” 21“Son of man,Or “mortal,” or “son of humankind” the arm of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, I have broken. And look, it has not been bound up for giving of a remedy, or for the placing of a splint to bind it up to make it strong to take hold of the sword.” 22Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: “Look! I am against Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and I will break his strong arm and the broken arm, and I will let the sword fall from his hand. 23And I will scatter Egypt among the nations, and I will disperse them among the countries. 24And I will strengthen the arm of the king of Babylon, and I will give my sword into his hand, and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan with the groaning of the mortally wounded before him.Literally “the face of him” 25And I will strengthen the arm of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh will fall. And they will know that I am Yahweh when I give my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will stretch it out to the land of Egypt. 26And I will scatter Egypt among the nations, and I will disperse them into the countries, and they will know that I am Yahweh.”
